main_definition: Cleanup refers to the process of removing dirt, clutter or unwanted items from an area, making it tidy and organized.

meanings_and_examples.example: After the storm, volunteers joined in to cleanup the streets by picking up scattered trash.
She spent her Saturday afternoon cleaning up her room, organizing clothes, and putting away books.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To fix or rectify a situation after it has become messy or complicated
meanings_and_examples.example: Following the office mishap where documents were scattered all over the floor, there was a major cleanup to restore order and locate missing papers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Removing unwanted items from software code
meanings_and_examples.example: The developers performed a cleanup of the legacy application's codebase by removing deprecated functions and optimizing algorithms.
